00020 /**
00021  * @file   ClfFile.cpp
00022  * @brief
00023  *         Read \link file-format-clf the ClfFile format \endlink for an overview.
00024  *         Read \link file-format-tsv the TsvFile docs \endlink more about TsvFile.
00025  */
00026 
00027 #include "file/TsvFile/ClfFile.h"
00028 
00029 /**
00030 \page file-format-clf File Format: CLF (NON-OFFICIAL-RELEASE)
00031 
00032 <center><b>DRAFT</b></center>
00033 
00034 The CLF (cel layout file) maps probe IDs to a particular location
00035 in the CEL file. The CLF file is based on version 2 of the
00036 <a href="./file-format-tsv.html">TSV file format</a>.
00037 
00038 The CLF file is based on version 1 of the \link file-format-tsv TSV file format \endlink.
00039 
00040 \section specs Specs & Features
00041 
00042 - Required headers
00043   - chip_type: indicates the chip type (as stored in the CEL file) which the clf file
00044     describes. Multiple chip_type headers may be present indicating the clf file
00045     can be used with any one of the listed chip types.
00046   - lib_set_name: indicates the name of a collection of related library files for a given
00047     chip. For example, PGF and CLF files intended to be used together should have
00048     the same lib_set_name. Only a single lib_set_name is allowed.
00049   - lib_set_version: indicates the version of a collection of related library files for
00050     a given chip. For example, PGF and CLF files intended to be used together should have
00051     the same lib_set_version. Only a single lib_set_version is allowed.
00052   - clf_format_version: currently the only documented and supported version is 1.0.
00053   - rows: the number of rows in the CEL file (1 base)
00054   - cols: the number of cols in the CEL file (1 base)
00055   - header0: indicates the values in the CLF file. A CLF file must contain
00056     probe_id, x, and y columns. The probe_id column must be unique. Other
00057     columns may be present.
00058 - Optional headers
00059   - sequential: When present, this header indicates that the relationship between
00060     probe IDs and x/y location is deterministic. The value of this key is the
00061     starting ID. See note below about Deterministic IDs. If sequential is
00062     specified, then the order header must also be supplied. The value must be
00063     an integer >= 0.
00064   - order: Indicates whether the IDs are enumerated in a column or row major order.
00065     Valid values are "col_major" and "row_major".  If order is specified, then
00066     sequential must also be specified.
00067   - create_date: timestamp for when the file was created
00068   - guid: a unique identifier for the fileA
00069   - other headers may be present
00070 - Required columns
00071   - per TSV format, order of columns is not guarateed
00072   - per TSV format, additional columns may be present
00073   - probe_id: A positive integer ID for the probe. Must be unique within the CLF file.
00074   - x: the x position of the probe in the CEL file. (0 base)
00075   - y: the y position of the probe in the CEL file. (0 base)
00076 
00077 \section deterministic Deterministic IDs
00078 
00079 In many cases, probe IDs are simply enumerated starting with a fixed number by walking
00080 through the CEL file in a column or row major order. When this is the case, hints may
00081 be provided in the headers which allow the location to be computed from the probe_id.
00082 This saves the work of reading the file.
00083 When sequential is specified along with col_major order, the the following determines
00084 probe IDs:
00085 
00086 \code
00087 probe_id = y*cols + x + sequential
00088 \endcode
00089 
00090 And for row_major:
00091 
00092 \code
00093 probe_id = x*rows + y + sequential
00094 \endcode
00095 
00096 \section implementation Parsing and Writing
00097 
00098 The official C++ parser used by affy can be found in APT under
00099 sdk/file/TsvFile/ClfFile.h. When possible, parsing and
00100 writing of CLF files should be done using this code.
00101 
00102 \section notes Notes
00103 
00104 ChipLayout used by APT (in sdk/chipstream) will currently only
00105 accept CLF files for which:
00106 
00107 - sequential=1
00108 - order=col_major 
00109 - order=row_major
00110 
00111 In fact all the coordinates are done as row_major and the library files
00112 with col_major in the header are due to a bug. Please use row_major going
00113 forward.
00114 
00115 
00116 \section clfExample1 Example 1
00117 
00118 \verbatim
00119 #%chip_type=HuEx-1_0-st-v2
00120 #%chip_type=HuEx-1_0-st-v1
00121 #%chip_type=HuEx-1_0-st-ta1
00122 #%lib_set_name=HuEx-1_0-st
00123 #%lib_set_version=r2
00124 #%create_date=Tue Sep 19 15:18:05 PDT 2006
00125 #%guid=0000008635-1158704285-0732263232-1857033251-0689718480
00126 #%clf_format_version=1.0
00127 #%rows=2560
00128 #%cols=2560
00129 #%sequential=1
00130 #%order=col_major
00131 #%header0=probe_id x y
00132 1 0 0
00133 2 1 0
00134 3 2 0
00135 4 3 0
00136 5 4 0
00137 6 5 0
00138 7 6 0
00139 ...
00140 \endverbatim
00141 
00142 \section related Related Pages
00143 
00144 - <a href="./file-format-tsv-notes.html">TsvFile Design Notes</a>
00145 - <a href="./file-format-tsv.html">TSV File Format</a>
00146 
00147 */
00148 
00149 namespace affx
00150 {
00151 /// @brief     Create the ClfFile object
00152 ClfFile::ClfFile()
00153 {
00154   makeClfBindings();
00155 }
00156 /// @brief     Destroy a ClfFile object
00157 ClfFile::~ClfFile()
00158 {
00159 }
00160 
00161 ///
00162 int ClfFile::getXMax()
00163 {
00164   int val;
00165   int rv;
00166 
00167   rv = m_tsv.getHeader("rows", val);
00168   Err::check(rv == TSV_OK, "No 'rows' header found in clf file");
00169   return val -1; // 1-Based to 0-based
00170 }
00171 
00172 int ClfFile::getYMax()
00173 {
00174   int val;
00175   int rv;
00176 
00177   rv = m_tsv.getHeader("cols", val);
00178   Err::check(rv == TSV_OK, "No 'cols' header found in clf file");
00179   return val -1; // 1-Based to 0-based
00180 }
00181 
00182 /// @brief     Return the value of the sequential header
00183 /// @return    int value of the header or -1 if not present
00184 int ClfFile::getSequential()
00185 {
00186   int val;
00187   int rv;
00188 
00189   rv = m_tsv.getHeader("sequential", val);
00190   if (rv == TSV_OK) {
00191     Err::check(val >= 0, "sequential header in clf file must be a value >= 0");
00192     return val;
00193   } else
00194     return -1;
00195 }
00196 
00197 /// @brief     Return the value of the order header
00198 /// @return    the value of the order header if present
00199 std::string ClfFile::getOrder()
00200 {
00201   std::string val;
00202   int rv;
00203 
00204   rv = m_tsv.getHeader("order", val);
00205   if (rv == TSV_OK) {
00206     Err::check(val.compare("row_major") == 0 || val.compare("col_major") == 0, 
00207                "order header in clf file must be set to 'row_major' (old mislabeled 'col_major' is tolerated due to old bug)");
00208     return val;
00209   } else {
00210     val.erase();
00211     return val;
00212   }
00213 }
00214 
00215 /// @brief     Make the bindings which define a CLF file
00216 void ClfFile::makeClfBindings()
00217 {
00218   m_tsv.unbindAll();
00219   //
00220   m_tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probe_id, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00221   m_tsv.bind(0, "x", &x, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00222   m_tsv.bind(0, "y", &y, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00223 }
00224 
00225 /// @brief     Open a CLF file
00226 /// @param     filename     the pathname of the file
00227 /// @return    tsv_return_t
00228 int ClfFile::open(const std::string& filename)
00229 {
00230   std::string val;
00231   int rc = m_tsv.open(filename);
00232   if (rc == TSV_OK) {
00233     int rv = m_tsv.getHeader("clf_format_version", val);
00234     Err::check(rv == TSV_OK, "No clf_format_version header in clf file");
00235     Err::check(val.compare("1.0") == 0, "Unable to handle clf file format");
00236   }
00237   return rc;
00238 }
00239 /// @brief     Start the write to a file
00240 /// @param     filename
00241 /// @return    tsv_return_t
00242 int ClfFile::write(const std::string& filename)
00243 {
00244   return m_tsv.writeTsv(filename);
00245 }
00246 /// @brief     Close a PGF file
00247 /// @return    tsv_return_t
00248 int ClfFile::close()
00249 {
00250   return m_tsv.close();
00251 }
00252 /// @brief     Rewind back to the start of the CLF data
00253 /// @return    tsv_return_t
00254 int ClfFile::rewind()
00255 {
00256   return m_tsv.rewind();
00257 }
00258 /// @brief     Skip to the next probe
00259 /// @return    TSV_LEVEL_LAST when out of probesets
00260 int ClfFile::next_probe()
00261 {
00262   return m_tsv.nextLevel(0);
00263 }
00264 /// @brief     Define a tsv file as a CLF file.
00265 /// @param     tsv       pointer to tsv to define
00266 /// @return    tsv_return_t
00267 int ClfFile::defineFileClf(TsvFile* tsv)
00268 {
00269   Err::check(tsv != NULL, "affx::ClfFile - no tsv file provided to defineFileClf");
00270   return tsv->defineFile("probe_id\tx\ty");
00271 }
00272 /// @brief     Define this file as a pgf file
00273 /// @return    tsv_return_t
00274 int ClfFile::defineFileClf()
00275 {
00276   return defineFileClf(&m_tsv);
00277 }
00278 };
